security_controls.name: Strict CLI Input Validation
security_controls.description: Implement rigorous validation and sanitization for all CLI commands to prevent command injection attacks.

security_controls.name: Encrypted Configuration Storage
security_controls.description: Encrypt sensitive configuration data at rest and in transit using AES-256 and enforce RBAC for access.

security_controls.name: Signed API Requests
security_controls.description: Require HTTPS with TLS 1.3 and HMAC-signed requests to prevent GitHub API tampering.

security_controls.name: Rate Limiting & Throttling
security_controls.description: Implement rate limiting (e.g., 100 requests/minute) and input validation to prevent DoS attacks.

security_controls.name: Token-Based CLI Authentication
security_controls.description: Enforce short-lived tokens with revocation and MFA for CLI access.

security_controls.name: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
security_controls.description: Mandate MFA for CLI access and administrative interfaces.

security_controls.name: Configuration Audit Logs
security_controls.description: Enable audit logging for configuration changes with real-time alerts.

security_controls.name: Network Segmentation
security_controls.description: Isolate backend services and GitHub integration in separate VLANs with strict firewall rules.

security_controls.name: Intrusion Detection System (IDS)
security_controls.description: Deploy IDS to monitor for suspicious API request patterns and CLI activity.

summary: This set of 15 security controls provides defense-in-depth protection against CLI injection, configuration exposure, API tampering, and DoS attacks. Controls include input validation, encryption, signed API requests, rate limiting, MFA, audit logging, network segmentation, and IDS. Prioritized for critical risks with a balance of effectiveness and implementation effort.
